name: KCEOC - Community Action Partnership
description: One of Kentucky's original 23 Community Action Agencies established in 1964, serving low-income individuals and families across 16 counties in eastern and central Kentucky. Provides comprehensive services including early childhood education, housing assistance, food pantries, emergency support, job training, senior services, and utility assistance. Operates Emergency Support Center and participates in Summer Food Service Program. Committed to helping people help themselves and creating positive community change.
source: Verified from official website and multiple online sources
eligibility_requirements: Low-income individuals and families. Specific eligibility varies by program. Income guidelines determined by federal poverty levels. Services available to residents of 16 counties in eastern and central Kentucky.
populations_served: Low-income families, children, seniors, individuals experiencing homelessness, job seekers, families in need of utility assistance
cost_information: Most services are free or low-cost based on income eligibility. Some programs may have sliding scale fees.
